intro: Palicourea lineariflora, commonly known as the linear-leaved palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or vine, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ethnobotanical studies.
